feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 10:30AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues due to warmer temperatures. * WHERE...The northern Copper River Basin along the Gulkana River and along Lake Louise Road.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 3:48PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Coffee and western Geneva Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 348 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Samson, or 10 miles northwest of Geneva, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 3:42PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Conecuh and northwestern Covington Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 341 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Red Level, or 13 miles southeast of Evergreen, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail.

entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Little River, west central Hempstead, northwestern Miller, southern Sevier, southeastern Howard, southeastern McCurtain and central Bowie Counties through 445 PM CDT... entry.cap:areaDesc: Hempstead; Howard; Little River; Miller; Sevier

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued June 05 at 1:57PM PDT until June 06 at 6:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Northwest to north winds 20 to 35 mph with gusts of 40 to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range and Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 AM PDT Monday.
